properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Ballyrogan, Buangor, Challicum.

  • This Advice message replaces the Advice message issued at 9:12 am on Friday 24th February. 
  • There is a grassfire at Hillside Rd, Buangor that is contained.
  • Crews will continue to monitor the fire.
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and monitor conditions.

Impacts in your area: 
  • Firefighters are attending to this fire. 
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • The Geelong Road is open with speed restrictions. 
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 25/02/2023 12:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

- Crews will continue to monitor the fire.


There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and monitor conditions.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
The Threat is Reduced following the grassfire at Doreen, Mernda, South Morang. 

  • This fire is under control. 
  • Firefighters will remain on scene overnight to patrol the fire. 
People located within Doreen, Mernda, South Morang should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.

Impacts in your area: 
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.  

This will be the final message issued for this fire. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires) 
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 

Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

ADVICE - GRASS FIRE - Threat Is Reduced
Incident Location: Horsley Cr, Doreen
Issue Date: Friday 24 February 2023, 10:23 pm
Next Update: Saturday 25 February 2023, 10:00 am

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/28991/moreinfo

The Threat is Reduced following the grassfire at Doreen, Mernda, South Morang. 

- This fire is under control. 
- Firefighters will remain on scene overnight to patrol the fire. 


People located within Doreen, Mernda, South Morang should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Flowerdale, Strath Creek, Break O'Day.

  • There is a grassfire at Spring Valley Rd, Flowerdale that is now under control.
  • This Advice message replaces the Watch and Act issued at 12.36pm. 
  • Firefighters, heavy machinery and aircraft will remain in the area. 
  • Smoke will be visible in your community.
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do: 
  • Keep the roads clear so emergency services can respond.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Spring Valley Road Between the Whittlesea-Yea Road and Upper King Parrot road is now open.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 25/02/2023 10:00 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.location: Break O'Day, Castella, Glenburn, Kinglake, Kinglake Central, Kinglake East, Pheasant Creek, Strath Creek, Clonbinane, Dixons Creek, Flowerdale, Homewood, Kinglake West, Murrindindi, Reedy Creek, St Andrews, Steels Creek, Strathewen, Toolangi, Yea
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Break O'Day, Castella, Clonbinane, Dixons Creek, Flowerdale, Glenburn, Homewood, Kinglake, Kinglake Central, Kinglake East, Kinglake West, Murrindindi, Pheasant Creek, Reedy Creek, St Andrews, Steels Creek, Strath Creek, Strathewen, Toolangi, Yea. 

Firefighters are taking advantage of the current weather conditions to undertake back burning activities on the southeast side of the Flowerdale-Spring Valley Rd fire, in the vicinity of Minto Rd and Barina Heights. Due to the increased northerly wind speeds, this will result in smoke being visible in your community for the next few days. 


There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 26/02/2023 11:40 am or as the situation changes.

Flowerdale Spring Valley Road Fire map

Smoke information: Smoke can affect peopleâ€™s health.  For more information visit: https://www.betterhealth.vic.gov.au/

  • People with pre-existing lung or heart conditions should rest as much as possible and keep away from the smoke. minimise smoke exposure by reducing your level of exercise during smoky conditions. If practical, stay indoors and keep windows closed until the smoke passes. People experiencing symptoms due to smoke exposure should seek medical advice or call NURSE-ON-CALL on 1300 60 60 24 

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

Due to the increased northerly wind speeds, this will result in smoke being visible in your community for the next few days.

properties.name: East Barham Rd, Barham
properties.webHeadline: A fire has started There is no immediate danger. Stay up to date in case the situation changes

Today, Fri, 24 Feb 2023 has been declared a day of Total Fire Ban in the Wimmera and South West district(s) of Victoria.  No fires can be lit or be allowed to remain alight in the open air from 12:01 AM on Fri, 24 Feb 2023 until 11:59 PM Fri, 24 Feb 2023.
